conclusion: Understand the flow of liquid through the baffles to determine which container (E or F) the liquid will flow into.
Baffle A is horizontal and points to the right.
Baffle B is vertical and points down.
Baffle C is diagonal and points to the right.
Baffle D is horizontal and points to the right.
Liquid will flow to the right through Baffle A.
Liquid will flow down through Baffle B.
Liquid will flow to the right through Baffle C.
Liquid will flow to the right through Baffle D.
Liquid starting from A will flow to the right.
Liquid starting from B will flow down.
Liquid starting from C will flow to the right.
Liquid starting from D will flow to the right.
Liquid flowing to the right from A, C, and D will eventually reach container E.
Liquid flowing down from B will be redirected by the baffles and eventually reach container F.
Liquid will flow into container E from A, C, and D.
Liquid will flow into container F from B.
